name: places/ChIJWeV3DMj3wokR0fOhbsSW3Z4
formattedAddress: 15 W 126th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 W 126th St, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: Words cannot adequately express how happy we are to have found Sandy and Music Together with Muse Arts (Harlem). She is truly remarkable! Her music class is our daughter’s favorite class, period.  Hands down! (And it’s a highlight of our week as well - so much so that we frequently go 2x per week!). Sandy infuses each class with incredible energy, her beautiful voice and a ton of fun, creating a structured environment that also allows the children almost complete freedom of expression (no running with drumsticks, please!). The songs — spanning upbeat melodies of celebration to peaceful lullabies — are from all over the world, are in major and minor keys and are expressed in many different styles and meters.  Sandy breaks down (in fun and accessible ways) the details/contexts of the songs in ways interesting to both the children and their caretakers. She provides instruments, rattles, drums, scarves and parachutes (!!) - and of course each class has a short free dance at the end! Our daughter sings herself to sleep every night with music we’ve learned from the class (now our 5th rotation!).  She especially loves the short video music lessons that Sandy posts online for members to help us bridge the time between classes as well. We couldn’t recommend Sandy’s class enough and can’t wait to experience the rest of her courses over the coming years! Thank you Sandy!!

originalText.text:
Sandy is awesome! She infuses infectious joy into the Music Together program. She's so engaging, positive, and fun. And kind! The classes are really entertaining, with dancing, singing, clapping, instrument playing, and my favorite, a calming lullaby ;). It's been so fun to watch my daughter go from a timid and swaying baby to a big kid that can't wait to jump on Sandy's lap and belt out tonal patterns. And now my daughter even teaches the songs to her brother at dinner, in the same manner that Sandy does. It's very cool to see this love of music flourish and we feel very lucky to have Sandy as a teacher.

(Also, the Music Together program itself is great - songs are catchy while not being annoying, cover a variety of styles, etc).

originalText.text: In Sandy’s classes, I get to see my son experience fun and freedom, AND I see him absorb the benefit of her deep musical expertise and gift for sharing it with even the youngest kids. It’s rare to have a class that introduces young children to complex concepts in a joyful, exciting way, but Muse Arts makes it look easy, and to top it off, Sandy’s responsive, communicative, and goes above and beyond to make sure things work for families. We’ve tried other music classes in the city; Sandy’s are on another level in terms of both the material she covers and her sensitivity to the kids she works with.

originalText.text: We’re wrapping up our third season with Sandy now and each one has been such a joy. Sandy has an incredible voice and brings the Music Together songs to life with her warmth and energy. We’ve watched our son go from observer to participant and it is such a delight to take part in music like this together, intentionally. We’ve had several friends drop in on the class and all have been inspired to find something similar in their areas - but I doubt any of them will find anything quite as good because there’s only one Sandy!
